intro: Goodenia appendiculata, commonly known as the woolly goodenia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant features a sprawling habit with hairy, glandular stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and a distinctive glandular structure. It is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in coastal or inland scrub habitats.
